name: Harmonious High-Achievers
signaturePattern: Virtuous cycle of sustainable excellence. High stability, fast cadence, low friction, exceptional culture.
metricsProfile: Elite DORA; SLOs consistently met; DX >4.0; regrettable attrition <3%. AI amplifies gains.
firstPriority: Maintain and export practices. Coach other teams. Guard against complacency.
antiPatternIfIgnored: Assumes this is "normal" and doesn't invest in maintaining the conditions that created it.

name: Pragmatic Performers
signaturePattern: Sustainable balance of speed and stability. Predictable delivery. Mature platform foundation. Safe to adopt AI.
metricsProfile: High DORA; solid SLO compliance; DX 3.5-4.0; moderate toil.
firstPriority: Optimize (CI speed, review latency, error budget policy). Safe to layer AI tooling.
antiPatternIfIgnored: Pushing for "elite" DORA without investing in the platform maturity to sustain it.

name: Stable and Methodical
signaturePattern: Prioritize quality and reliability above all. Deliberate, high-quality delivery. Cadence too slow for aggressive go-to-market.
metricsProfile: Low DF but very low CFR; strong SLO compliance; long Lead Time due to process, not dysfunction.
firstPriority: Reduce unnecessary gates. Introduce risk-tiered release paths. Differentiate low-risk from high-risk changes.
antiPatternIfIgnored: Treating slowness as laziness. The team is slow because they care about quality. Remove friction, don't add pressure.

name: High-Impact, Low-Cadence
signaturePattern: Brilliant output but severe delivery bottlenecks. Structural understaffing, deep specialization, cross-team dependency stalls.
metricsProfile: Long Lead Time; high blocked work rate; low DF; high individual output but low team throughput.
firstPriority: Unblock: reduce cross-team dependencies, broaden knowledge distribution, staff the bottleneck.
antiPatternIfIgnored: Celebrating heroic output while ignoring that the hero is a single point of failure and a flight risk.

name: Constrained by Process
signaturePattern: Bureaucratic treadmill. Engineers know what to build but momentum destroyed by approvals, CABs, excessive meetings.
metricsProfile: Lead Time dominated by wait states (not active work); meeting load high; DX low on "friction" items.
firstPriority: Eliminate or streamline approval processes. Risk-tier changes. Introduce self-service deploy paths.
antiPatternIfIgnored: Automating the wrong process. Don't digitize a bad workflow — eliminate it.

name: Legacy Bottleneck
signaturePattern: Capable engineers trapped in reactive firefighting against unstable, aging architecture. Trivial features require immense effort.
metricsProfile: High MTTR; high CFR; CI/CD fragile; tech debt consuming >40% of capacity; DX very low.
firstPriority: Invest in architecture and platform before optimizing flow. Ring-fence modernization capacity.
antiPatternIfIgnored: Demanding DORA improvements without funding the architectural remediation that makes them possible.

name: Foundational Challenges
signaturePattern: Constant high-pressure firefighting. Chronic slow delivery and systemic instability.
metricsProfile: All DORA metrics poor; SLOs frequently breached or undefined; DX <3.0; high attrition.
firstPriority: Stabilize first: basic CI/CD, incident response, on-call rotation, team safety. Metrics come after survival.
antiPatternIfIgnored: Imposing a measurement framework on a team that is drowning. Fix the environment, then measure.

name: Chaotic High-Variance
signaturePattern: Oscillation between great sprints and terrible sprints. Unpredictable delivery with wild metric swings. Signals leadership instability or estimation failure.
metricsProfile: DORA metrics swing >50% sprint-to-sprint; sprint commitment highly variable (40-90%); DX scores inconsistent across surveys; some weeks elite, some weeks crisis.
firstPriority: Stabilize the basics: consistent sprint planning, protected capacity, interrupt budgets. Reduce variance before optimizing averages.
antiPatternIfIgnored: Celebrating the good sprints while ignoring that the bad sprints destroy predictability and trust with stakeholders.

name: Specialized Silo
signaturePattern: Deep expertise in narrow domains with minimal cross-training. High bus factor — metrics look OK on the surface but organization is structurally fragile.
metricsProfile: DORA metrics appear healthy; review load heavily concentrated on 1-2 people; cross-team dependency resolution slow; knowledge concentration dangerous.
firstPriority: Broaden knowledge distribution. Pair programming rotations. Document tribal knowledge. Staff redundancy for critical paths.
antiPatternIfIgnored: Assuming healthy metrics mean a healthy team. One key departure away from cascade failure — the metrics won't warn you until it's too late.

name: Stalled Transformation
signaturePattern: Mid-migration between architectures or platforms. Not broken but not stable. Fragile state where old and new systems coexist with friction.
metricsProfile: Metrics show mixed signals — some services improving while others degrade. Lead Time bimodal. Tech debt ratio climbing as migration stalls. Team morale declining from prolonged uncertainty.
firstPriority: Complete the migration or make a deliberate decision to stop. The worst outcome is being stuck in the middle indefinitely. Set a deadline and staff accordingly.
antiPatternIfIgnored: Assuming the migration will 'finish eventually.' Stalled transformations become permanent technical debt with compounding maintenance costs for both old and new systems.
